intro: Strobilanthes guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi flame flower, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, with red or orange hues, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
